'''Documentation for installing Shiny Server'''[[BR]]

To install and run the Shiny Server, R must be installed. The new webserver is running Ubuntu Xenial so the newest version of R could not be installed.
R version 3.2.3 (2015-12-10) -- "Wooden Christmas-Tree"
To install R, first add the CRAN repo to by inserting the following line in to /etc/apt/sources.list:
{{{
deb http://cran.rstudio.com/bin/linux/ubuntu xenial main
}}}
and install R as
{{{
sudo apt-get install r-base r-base-dev
}}}
Then install Shiny:
{{{
sudo su - -c "R -e \"install.packages('shiny', repos='http://cran.rstudio.com/')\""
}}}
You can now install Shiny-Server:
{{{
sudo apt-get install gdebi-core
wget https://download3.rstudio.org/ubuntu-14.04/x86_64/shiny-server-1.5.9.923-amd64.deb
sudo gdebi shiny-server-1.5.9.923-amd64.deb
}}}
Shiny-Server should now be running. To check status, start, stop or restart use:
{{{
sudo systemctl status shiny-server
sudo systemctl start shiny-server
sudo systemctl stop shiny-server
sudo systemctl restart shiny-server
}}}

Make sure to install some of the fundamental packages. In R (sudo R) install the following:
{{{
install.packages("RSQlite")
install.packages("plyr")
install.packages("reshape2")
install.packages("data.table")
install.packages("ggplot2")
install.packages("ggthemes")
install.packages("dplyr")
install.packages("dbplyr")
install.packages("DBI")
}}}
Note that ggthemes is version 3.0.4. The newest version of ggthemes does not work with R v.3.2.3.[[BR]]

HARPbase was installed as:[[BR]]
{{{
R CMD INSTALL HARPbase
}}}
from within the Harp/Rlib.src directory.[[BR]]

A few useful links are given below:[[BR]]
For setting up Shiny-Server on AWS [https://towardsdatascience.com/how-to-host-a-r-shiny-app-on-aws-cloud-in-7-simple-steps-5595e7885722][[BR]]
Install shiny-server [https://www.r-bloggers.com/install-shiny-server-for-r-on-ubuntu-the-right-way/][[BR]]
Deploy and configure shiny-server: [https://www.linode.com/docs/development/r/how-to-deploy-rshiny-server-on-ubuntu-and-debian/]
